excerpt: Oaxaca de Juárez, or simply Oaxaca, is the capital and largest city of the eponymous Mexican state of Oaxaca. Wikipedia.
detail_description: Oaxaca, the capital and largest city of the Mexican state of Oaxaca, is a vibrant destination that offers a rich tapestry of cultural experiences. Throughout the year, visitors can immerse themselves in marvelous festivities that showcase the heart and essence of the Oaxacan people. From Carnival celebrations to Easter activities and Lenten traditions, these events reflect the joy, respect, and devotion of the local community.
name: Oaxaca
address: Mexico

excerpt: Archaeological site featuring a complex of stone pyramids on an elevated area with sweeping views.
detail_description: Monte Albán is a captivating archaeological site that sits majestically on a 1,300-foot plateau, offering breathtaking views of the surrounding landscape. This ancient ceremonial center is renowned for its impressive stone pyramids and well-preserved structures, showcasing the rich history of the Zapotec civilization dating back to around 500 B.C.E. Visitors can explore significant attractions such as the Great Plaza, Ball Game area, Danzarines Building, and Tomb 7.
name: Monte Albán
address: 71233 Monte Albán, Oax., Mexico

excerpt: Vibrant covered marketplace with vendors selling produce, prepared foods, crafts & textiles.
detail_description: Mercado Benito Juárez is a bustling covered marketplace in Oaxaca City, offering a wide array of goods and local products. It's known for its vibrant atmosphere and diverse offerings, including produce, prepared foods, crafts, textiles, and folkloric fabrics. Adjacent to it is Mercado 20 de Noviembre, where you can find artisanal items like hand-crafted huaraches and elaborately embroidered blouses.
name: Mercado Benito Juárez
address: Las Casas S/N, OAX_RE_BENITO JUAREZ, Centro, 68000 Oaxaca de Juárez, Oax., Mexico

excerpt: Historic complex featuring a church with an opulent, gilded interior & a monastery turned museum.
detail_description: Templo de Santo Domingo de Guzmán is a historic complex in Oaxaca, Mexico, featuring a church with an opulent, gilded interior and a monastery turned museum. The temple is an example of baroque Hispanic architecture and has been the site of significant historical events. It was declared a World Heritage Site by UNESCO. Visitors can also explore the nearby Botanical Gardens to see a variety of plant species typical of the region.
name: Templo de Santo Domingo de Guzmán
address: C. Macedonio Alcalá s/n, RUTA INDEPENDENCIA, Centro, 68000 Oaxaca de Juárez, Oax., Mexico

excerpt: Bustling traditional covered market with stalls for fresh produce, baked goods & local street foods.
detail_description: Mercado 20 de Noviembre is a bustling traditional covered market in Oaxaca City, Mexico. It offers a wide variety of goods, including fresh produce, baked goods, and local street foods. Adjacent to the market are stalls selling artisanal products such as hand-crafted huaraches and elaborately embroidered blouses. The market is known for its diverse offerings and indigenous influence, with vendors speaking a variety of languages including Spanish.
name: Mercado 20 de Noviembre
address: 20 de Noviembre 512, OAX_RE_BENITO JUAREZ, Centro, 68000 Oaxaca de Juárez, Oax., Mexico

excerpt: Small, bustling public square surrounded by restaurants, vendors & historic buildings.
detail_description: Zócalo Oaxaca, also known as Plaza de la Constitucion de Oaxaca, is a bustling public square at the historical center of downtown Oaxaca. Surrounded by historic buildings and vibrant cafes, it's a prime spot for people-watching and picking up souvenirs. The square is shaded by leafy trees, providing a relaxing place to cool off in the shade.
name: Zócalo de la Ciudad de Oaxaca (Plaza de La Constitución)
address: Portal del Palacio, Centro, 68000 Oaxaca de Juárez, Oax., Mexico

excerpt: This cultural center houses archaeological artifacts & ancient books in a 17th-century convent.
detail_description: The Museum of Cultures of Oaxaca, Santo Domingo is a cultural center located in a 17th-century convent. It houses archaeological artifacts, ancient books, Spanish colonial artifacts, and artwork. The museum offers exhibits spanning various time periods such as ancient history, the Middle Ages, BC era, and prehistoric times. Visitors can also explore maritime history exhibitions and traditional wear and handicraft works. The central courtyard with a fountain provides an impressive backdrop for photos.
name: Museum of Cultures of Oaxaca, Santo Domingo
address: 1a. Cerrada de Macedonio Alcala s/n, RUTA INDEPENDENCIA, Centro, 68000 Oaxaca de Juárez, Oax., Mexico

excerpt: Curated grounds showcasing local Oaxacan plant life, plus a cultural center in a former convent.
detail_description: Jardín Etnobotánico de Oaxaca, also known as Oaxaca Ethnological Gardens, is a meticulously curated space that showcases the rich diversity of local plant life in Oaxaca. Designed by artist Francisco Toledo and opened in 1998, this garden spans over 2.3 hectares and features hundreds of native plant species representing the flora of Oaxaca State.
name: Jardín Etnobotánico de Oaxaca
address: Reforma Sur n, RUTA INDEPENDENCIA, Centro, 68000 Oaxaca de Juárez, Oax., Mexico

excerpt: Casual eatery offering local dishes made from area-sourced ingredients, plus outdoor seating.
detail_description: Criollo is a popular casual eatery in Oaxaca City, known for its locally sourced ingredients and outdoor seating. It is part of an exclusive selection of restaurants representing the best of Oaxacan cuisine, from traditional roots to innovative interpretations. The restaurant is led by renowned chefs Enrique Olvera and Luis Arellano, offering refined dishes in a beautifully designed space with a relaxed, open-air vibe.
name: Criollo
address: Francisco I. Madero 129, Santa María del Marquesado, Centro, 68000 Oaxaca de Juárez, Oax., Mexico

excerpt: Tranquil Barrio de Jalatlaco is home to the simple, stone Church of San Matías Jalatlaco, dating from the 18th century. The area’s charming cobbled streets are lined with colorfully painted facades and dotted with shops selling organic produce and chocolate to visitors. Small restaurants serve Oaxacan and Italian cuisine, while local women cook and sell traditional street food outside their homes.
detail_description: Barrio de Jalatlaco is a serene neighborhood in Oaxaca, featuring the simple yet beautiful Church of San Matías Jalatlaco from the 18th century. Its picturesque cobbled streets are adorned with vibrant painted facades and offer a variety of shops selling organic produce and chocolate. Visitors can savor Oaxacan and Italian cuisine at small restaurants or indulge in traditional street food prepared by local women.
name: Barrio de Jalatlaco
address: 68080 Oaxaca, Mexico

excerpt: Modern Oaxacan dishes made with organic vegetables & free-range meat, served on a stylish patio.
detail_description: Casa Oaxaca el Restaurante is a modern eatery in Mexico that offers organic Oaxacan dishes made with free-range meat and fresh vegetables. The restaurant provides a stylish patio setting for diners to enjoy their meals. It is part of an exclusive selection of restaurants featured in the Michelin Guide 2024, showcasing the best of Oaxacan cuisine from traditional roots to innovative interpretations.
name: Casa Oaxaca el Restaurante
address: Constitución 104-A, RUTA INDEPENDENCIA, Centro, 68000 Oaxaca de Juárez, Oax., Mexico

detail_description: Monte Albán is conveniently situated just a short 20-minute drive, approximately 9.7km/6 miles southwest of Oaxaca City, making it an ideal day trip destination. Navigating the journey from Oaxaca City to Monte Albán can be perplexing due to various transportation options available, which will be thoroughly discussed here.
name: Monte Albán
address: Oaxaca, Mexico

excerpt: Oaxaca is a state in southern Mexico known for its indigenous cultures. Its capital city of the same name is noted for colonial buildings often made of green volcanic stone. In the main square, El Zócalo, stands the baroque Catedral de Oaxaca. Beyond the city, pre-Columbian archaeological sites include Mitla, Yagul and Monte Albán, the Zapotec capital dating to around 500 B.C.
detail_description: Oaxaca, located in southern Mexico, is renowned for its rich indigenous heritage and colonial architecture. The capital city, also named Oaxaca, boasts stunning colonial buildings constructed from green volcanic stone. At the heart of the city lies El Zócalo, a vibrant main square dominated by the baroque Catedral de Oaxaca.
name: Oaxaca
address: Mexico

detail_description: Zocalo, also known as the Plaza de la Constitucion, is the central square in Oaxaca and a focal point of the city. The grand yet welcoming square is shaded by large trees and features the impressive Palacio de Gobierno. Visitors can explore numerous outdoor and rooftop restaurants, galleries, and street vendors offering various foods and goods. Nearby streets are bustling with activity, including balloon vendors and hawker stalls.
name: Zocalo
address: Av. de la Independencia 709, RUTA INDEPENDENCIA, Centro, 68000 Oaxaca de Juárez, Oax., Mexico

excerpt: 1690 church, dedicated to the patron saint of Oaxaca, featuring ornate decor & a baroque pipe organ.
detail_description: This 17th-century church dedicated to the patron saint of Oaxaca is a beautiful place to visit. The facade is covered in ornate baroque decorations, and the interior features a sparkling pipe organ. There's also a lively plaza nearby with steps that serve as a seating area.
name: Basílica de Nuestra Señora de la Soledad
address: Av. de la Independencia 107, CALZADA MADERO, Centro, 68000 Oaxaca de Juárez, Oax., Mexico

excerpt: Modest museum with free admission featuring textiles of the region & workshops for adults & kids.
detail_description: Located in the City of Oaxaca, Mexico, the Museo Textil de Oaxaca (MTO) is housed in a renovated eighteenth-century mansion. Since its opening in 2008, the museum has been dedicated to showcasing a wide variety of textile techniques, materials, and designs from Oaxaca and around the world. Through cultural and educational activities, MTO aims to improve the lives of textile artisans within their communities.
name: Museo Textil de Oaxaca
address: Miguel Hidalgo 917, Centro Histórico, 68000 Oaxaca de Juárez, Oax., Mexico

excerpt: Artisan bread, pastries & brunch dishes at an airy cafe-bakery with tables in a covered courtyard.
detail_description: Boulenc is a popular European-style bakery and restaurant located in Centro, Oaxaca. Known for its fresh-baked sourdough bread, delectable pastries, and diverse menu featuring French, Italian, and international favorites like reuben sandwiches, wood-oven pizzas with sourdough crusts, egg sandwiches on homemade English muffins, shakshuka, and croque-monsieurs. The cafe offers an airy ambiance with tables in a covered courtyard.
name: Boulenc
address: C. Porfirio Díaz 207, RUTA INDEPENDENCIA, Centro, 68000 Oaxaca de Juárez, Oax., Mexico

excerpt: Housemade mezcales, cocktails & seasonal Oaxacan dishes in a leafy indoor/outdoor setting.
detail_description: Los Danzantes is a popular restaurant located in the heart of Oaxaca's downtown, offering a modern take on Mexican and Oaxacan cuisine. The restaurant is known for its housemade mezcales, cocktails, and seasonal dishes served in a charming indoor/outdoor setting. What sets Los Danzantes apart is its extensive vegetarian and vegan options that highlight local, seasonal ingredients from nearby farms.
name: Los Danzantes
address: C. Macedonio Alcalá 403-interior 4, RUTA INDEPENDENCIA, Centro, 68000 Oaxaca de Juárez, Oax., Mexico

detail_description: Selva Oaxaca Cocktail Bar is a trendy spot that opened last year, offering refined mezcal cocktails in a beautiful midcentury modern setting. The bar is known for its creative use of ingredients like hoja santa, a tropical plant with aromatic leaves used in Mesoamerican beverages and even chocolates. The menu at Selva Oaxaca Cocktail Bar pays homage to naturalist Alexander Von Humboldt's work, featuring cocktails that blend Mexican and international elements to recreate intricate ecosystems.
name: Selva Oaxaca Cocktail Bar
address: C. Macedonio Alcalá #403-int. 6, RUTA INDEPENDENCIA, Centro, 68000 Oaxaca de Juárez, Oax., Mexico

excerpt:
Santa María Atzompa is a town and municipality located in the Mexican state of Oaxaca, about five km from the state capital of Oaxaca.
It is part of the Centro District in the Valles Centrales region. The town was founded between the 7th and 9th centuries as a satellite of the ancient Zapotec city of Monte Albán. Wikipedia.
detail_description: Santa María Atzompa is a charming town and municipality situated just five kilometers from the state capital of Oaxaca in Mexico. This historic town, which dates back to between the 7th and 9th centuries, was established as a satellite of the ancient Zapotec city of Monte Albán. It is part of the Centro District in the Valles Centrales region.
name: Santa María Atzompa
address: Oaxaca, Mexico

excerpt: Landmark cathedral started in 1535, consecrated in 1733 & containing baroque pieces & treasures.
detail_description: The Catedral Metropolitana de Oaxaca Nuestra Señora de la Asunción is a historic landmark that began construction in 1535 and was consecrated in 1733. It houses baroque pieces and treasures, making it a significant cultural site. Located just north of the Zocalo, the cathedral has undergone reconstruction following earthquakes in the 16th and 18th centuries.
name: Catedral Metropolitana de Oaxaca Nuestra Señora de la Asunción
address: Av. de la Independencia 700, Centro, 68000 Oaxaca de Juárez, Oax., Mexico

excerpt: Elegant early-1900s building with an opulent theater staging performing arts & cultural events.
detail_description: Teatro Macedonio Alcalá is an elegant early-1900s building that houses a magnificent theater hosting performing arts and cultural events. The construction of this beautiful French-style structure began in 1903 and was completed in August 1909, later being inaugurated on September 5 of the same year. Formerly known by different names, it was eventually named after Oaxacan musician and composer Macedonian Alcala.
name: TEATRO MACEDONIO ALCALÁ
address: Av. de la Independencia 900, Centro, 68000 Oaxaca de Juárez, Oax., Mexico

excerpt: Gallery in a restored 17th-century building with works by local graphic artists, lectures & events.
detail_description: The Museum of Oaxacan Painters, located in a restored 17th-century building, offers a great exhibition of recognized local artists. The gallery showcases paintings, sculptures, and installations by local graphic artists and features lectures and events. Visitors can expect to see modern works from local artists including painting, woodworking, and mixed media. The museum is well-organized with spacious and clean art exhibitions that beautifully depict local themes.
name: Museo de los Pintores Oaxaqueños
address: Av. de la Independencia 607, RUTA INDEPENDENCIA, Centro, 68000 Oaxaca de Juárez, Oax., Mexico

excerpt: This museum dedicated to Benito Juárez is housed in a 19th-century home where he once lived.
detail_description: Nestled in the heart of Oaxaca City, the Museo de Sitio Casa Juárez is a captivating destination that offers visitors a glimpse into the life of one of Mexico's most esteemed presidents, Benito Juárez. This charming museum is situated in a historic 19th-century residence where Juárez spent part of his youth. As you wander through its halls, you'll uncover fascinating insights into his early years and significant contributions to Mexican history.
name: Museo de Sitio Casa Juárez
address: Manuel, C. de Manuel García Vigil 609, 68000 Oaxaca de Juárez, Oax., Mexico

excerpt: Polished Colonial-style hotel in a 16th-century convent with outdoor dining, a bar & a pool.
detail_description: Nestled in the heart of Oaxaca, Quinta Real is a stunning hotel that beautifully marries history with luxury. Set within a 16th-century convent, this polished Colonial-style retreat offers guests an enchanting experience surrounded by lush gardens and charming courtyards. Just a short stroll from iconic landmarks like Santo Domingo Square and Zocalo Square, it’s perfectly situated for exploring the city’s rich culture.
name: Quinta Real
address: 5 de Mayo 300, RUTA INDEPENDENCIA, Centro, 68000 Oaxaca de Juárez, Oax., Mexico

detail_description: Guelaguetza, a renowned folkloric dance and musical festival, is held in July and draws large crowds, causing room rates to increase during this time. Additionally, prices also spike during the Day of the Dead celebrations in late October and early November, as well as the Christmas and Easter holiday periods. It's worth noting that mid-July through August marks the Mexican vacation season, leading to higher accommodation costs.
name: Guelaguetza
address: 68070 Oaxaca, Mexico

detail_description: Levadura de Olla Restaurante in Oaxaca City has played a significant role in the resurgence of mezcal, once considered a humble drink. The restaurant offers an extensive selection of mezcal options, reflecting the city's newfound appreciation for this native spirit. Additionally, Levadura de Olla is celebrated for its exceptional Oaxacan cuisine, particularly its emphasis on mole dishes and inventive creations such as guacamole with chapulines (grasshoppers).
name: Levadura de Olla Restaurante
address: C. de Manuel García Vigil 304, RUTA INDEPENDENCIA, Centro, 68000 Oaxaca de Juárez, Oax., Mexico

excerpt: The political heart of the city, this square with a large flag borders the Municipal Palace.
detail_description: Plaza de la Danza is a significant square in Oaxaca City, located near the base of Cerro del Fortin hill. It was built in 1959 with local volcanic stone and serves as a venue for art exhibitions, political rallies, music performances, and traditional dance events. The square is also known for its enormous sand tapestries during Dia de Muertos.
name: Plaza de la Danza
address: C. 2 de Abril, CALZADA MADERO, Centro, 68000 Oaxaca de Juárez, Oax., Mexico

detail_description: Alameda de Leon is a lively plaza adjacent to the iconic Zocalo in the city. It's a great spot for free entertainment, with street artists and marimba musicians entertaining the crowds under the shade of trees. The plaza is also home to notable landmarks like the Metropolitan Cathedral and State Government Palace. Visitors can experience vibrant performances by brass bands and elegant danzon music, adding to the lively atmosphere of this historic square.
name: Alameda de Leon
address: Centro, 68000 Oaxaca de Juárez, Oax., Mexico

detail_description: If you're looking to deepen your understanding and appreciation of Mezcal, the Mezcal Tasting Room by Gül-Roo in Oaxaca City is a must-visit. This tasting room offers a formal yet enjoyable experience where you can learn about the intricate distilling process while savoring 12 delicious varieties of Mezcal. The knowledgeable host, fluent in English, passionately answers all your questions.
name: Mezcal Tasting Room by Gül-Roo
address: Labastida 115-Local 7, RUTA INDEPENDENCIA, Centro, 68000 Oaxaca de Juárez, Oax., Mexico

detail_description: The charming borough of Oaxaca, often referred to as a quieter version of Centro, is known for its vibrant and captivating street art scene. Visitors can explore the area's colorful and beautiful streets, which are adorned with striking graffiti. Additionally, there are highly recommended art galleries showcasing impressive works that are definitely worth a visit. While some may find the art prices to be on the higher side, the overall experience of immersing oneself in this artistic enclave is truly remarkable.
name: Street Art
address: C. Porfirio Díaz 510A, RUTA INDEPENDENCIA, Centro, 68000 Oaxaca de Juárez, Oax., Mexico

excerpt: Museum in a 1700s house featuring permanent & rotating exhibitions of contemporary Mexican art.
detail_description: The Museum of Contemporary Art and Oaxaca Cultures, also known as MACO, is located in a 17th-century mansion called La Casa de Cortes. This lavish building was acquired by the state government in 1986 and became the home of MACO in 1992. The museum features both permanent and rotating exhibitions of contemporary Mexican art, showcasing works by local artists such as Rufino Tamayo, Francisco Toledo, Nieto, and Aquino.
name: Museum of Contemporary Art and Oaxaca Cultures
address: C. Macedonio Alcalá 202, RUTA INDEPENDENCIA, Centro, 68000 Oaxaca de Juárez, Oax., Mexico

excerpt: Charming museum featuring stamps & surrealist art, plus a tranquil patio & gift shop.
detail_description: The Museum of Filatelia Mufi showcases unique stamps and surrealist art from Mexico. The tranquil patio and gift shop make it a great place to relax after a busy day in the city.
name: Museo De La Filatelia MUFI
address: C/ de la Constitución 201, RUTA INDEPENDENCIA, Centro, 68000 Oaxaca de Juárez, Oax., Mexico

excerpt: City park with walking paths, flower beds, palm trees & a monument to a former Mexican president.
detail_description: El Llano park, situated northwest of the Santo Domingo complex in Oaxaca, features a spacious leafy garden with walking paths and beautiful flower beds. The park boasts tall palm trees and a monument dedicated to a former Mexican president. A popular spot for locals to enjoy the green space, visitors can find numerous food vendors selling snacks and various toys/balloons. Outdoor activities such as inline skating courses and judo classes are also available for enthusiasts.
name: El Llano
address: RUTA INDEPENDENCIA, Centro, 68000 Oaxaca de Juárez, Oax., Mexico

detail_description: A San Antonio Arrazola is a charming village in Oaxaca, Mexico, known for its vibrant and whimsical alebrijes, which are colorful animal sculptures. The village is filled with workshops where local artisans carve and paint these unique creations, showcasing their incredible talent and creativity.
name: A San Antonio Arrazola
address: 71233 Oax., Mexico

name: TEMPLO DE SAN FELIPE NERI
address: Av. de la Independencia 407, RUTA INDEPENDENCIA, Centro, 68000 Oaxaca de Juárez, Oax., Mexico

detail_description: Pasillo de Humo is a renowned Oaxacan restaurant that offers a modern take on traditional dishes, attracting both locals and visitors. The menu showcases the region's diverse ingredients, blending innovation with authentic culinary heritage. At Mercado 20 de Noviembre, meat enthusiasts can explore various vendors offering an array of meats to be smoked on-site and served with accompaniments like tortillas, pickled veggies, salsas, and cilantro.
name: Pasillo de Humo
address: 20 De Noviembre, 68000, Miguel Cabrera 116, Centro, 68000 Oaxaca de Juárez, Oax., Mexico

detail_description: Sabina Sabe is a vibrant and trendy bar located in Oaxaca, offering a unique blend of local and international flavors in its inventive cocktails and delicious food. This top bar is renowned for its focus on mezcal, boasting an impressive selection of craft drinks that highlight the versatility of Oaxaca's beloved spirit. The menu features dishes crafted with fresh, local ingredients and creative twists to perfectly complement the vibrant cocktail list.
name: Sabina Sabe
address: 5 de Mayo 209, RUTA INDEPENDENCIA, Centro, 68000 Oaxaca de Juárez, Oax., Mexico

excerpt: Airy, stylish rooms with free Wi-Fi in an elegant boutique hotel featuring a bohemian cafe.
detail_description: Casa Antonieta is a chic boutique hotel located just two blocks from the lively Zocalo in Oaxaca's historic center. Housed in a meticulously restored 16th-century building, this elegant hotel offers 12 airy and stylish rooms with free Wi-Fi. The property, which was previously a monks' convent and later a private residence, seamlessly blends history with contemporary flair. Each room features neutral hues, natural furnishings made from sustainable materials, and modern amenities for comfort and luxury.
name: Casa Antonieta
address: Miguel Hidalgo 911, Centro, 68000 Oaxaca de Juárez, Oax., Mexico

excerpt: Inventive global cuisine with an accent on regional produce in a subdued, timber-ceilinged space.
detail_description: Origen is a restaurant in Oaxaca that offers inventive global cuisine with a focus on regional produce. Chef Rodolfo Castellanos, a native of Oaxaca, showcases modern interpretations of traditional Oaxacan classics at Origen. Influenced by his upbringing and his mother's kitchen, Castellanos combines French training with Mexican culinary traditions to create unique dishes like octopus and sweetbread tlayuda.
name: Origen
address: Av Benito Juárez 308, RUTA INDEPENDENCIA, Centro, 68000 Oaxaca de Juárez, Oax., Mexico

excerpt: Storied facility named after Mexican photographer Manuel Álvarez Bravo hosting workshops & exhibits.
detail_description: Photographic Center Manuel Alvaro Bravo, named after the renowned Mexican photographer Manuel Álvarez Bravo, is a significant hub for photography enthusiasts in Oaxaca. Housed in a historic colonial building, it showcases both historical and contemporary photographic works through rotating exhibits. The center plays a vital role in promoting the art of photography and offers workshops as well. Visitors can explore galleries dedicated to Álvarez Bravo's photography, which documented local residents and festivities.
name: Photographic Center Manuel Alvaro Bravo
address: C. de Manuel Bravo 104, RUTA INDEPENDENCIA, Centro, 68000 Oaxaca de Juárez, Oax., Mexico

detail_description: Los Amantes Mezcalería is a renowned Oaxaca mezcal brand known for its slightly lower alcohol volume compared to others, making it a great choice for those new to mezcal. With just three mezcals - joven, reposado, and anejo - Los Amantes focuses on quality over quantity.
name: Los Amantes Mezcalería
address: Ignacio Allende 107, RUTA INDEPENDENCIA, Centro, 68000 Oaxaca de Juárez, Oax., Mexico

detail_description: The Oaxaca Free Walking Tour is a great way to explore the city and get acquainted with its history and culture. The tour takes you past beautiful churches, through various markets, and off the beaten track to discover hidden gems. Knowledgeable guides share stories and insights about the region, offering alternative views and places to visit. While it's not the best tour for some, considering it's free, it's a good option.
name: Oaxaca Free Walking Tour
address: Av. de la Independencia 900, Centro, 68000 Oaxaca de Juárez, Oax., Mexico

excerpt: Charming museum with a broad collection of pre-Hispanic Mexican art, plus workshops & events.
detail_description: Nestled in the heart of Oaxaca, the Museo de Arte Prehispánico de México Rufino Tamayo is a captivating destination for anyone intrigued by Mexico's rich history. This charming museum showcases an extensive collection of pre-Hispanic art, featuring original artifacts from across the country, with a special emphasis on pieces from Oaxaca.
name: Museo de Arte Prehispánico de México Rufino Tamayo
address: Av. José María Morelos 503, RUTA INDEPENDENCIA, Centro, 68000 Oaxaca de Juárez, Oax., Mexico

detail_description: Sangre de Cristo, also known as the Preciosa Sangre de Cristo Church, is a charming small church located in the heart of Oaxaca. Situated near the Santo Domingo church on the pedestrianized street of Alcala, it offers a serene and simple facade that invites visitors to step inside. The interior boasts a minimalist style adorned with sculptures of saints that harmonize with its hallway and benches.
name: Sangre de Cristo
address: Templo de Sangre de Cristo, C. de Mariano Abasolo, RUTA INDEPENDENCIA, Centro, 68000 Oaxaca de Juárez, Oax., Mexico

detail_description: Amá Terraza is a trendy rooftop spot located in the stylish Casa Antonieta hotel, offering guests a panoramic view of the city. The terrace boasts a cozy ambiance with lounge chairs, string lights, and an abundance of greenery creating an urban jungle vibe. Whether you're looking for a peaceful atmosphere to enjoy coffee, small plates, or evening cocktails, this terrace provides various seating options both indoors and outdoors.
name: Amá Terraza
address: Miguel Hidalgo 911, Centro, 68000 Oaxaca de Juárez, Oax., Mexico

name: Colectivo/Autobus para Mitla, Tlacolula, El Tule
address: De Los Derechos Humanos 210, Centro, 68000 Oaxaca de Juárez, Oax., Mexico

detail_description: Plaza de Lucha Libre in Oaxaca is a must-visit for fans of the sport, especially after its appearance in the movie Nacho Libre. The venue, originally a parking lot transformed into a wrestling arena on weekends, offers two seating options: plastic chairs around the ring or stands with a metal structure. There are locker rooms for both rough and technical wrestlers.
name: Plaza de Lucha Libre
address: Fresnito, Universidad, Exhacienda Candiani, 71233 Santa Cruz Xoxocotlán, Oax., Mexico

detail_description: Casa Oaxaca offers a delightful dining experience with its diverse culinary offerings. The cafe, led by chef Alejandro Ruiz, serves an ideal first meal with its delicious breakfast options. Guests can savor the enfrijolada, a local favorite featuring just-cooked tortillas topped with avocado-leaf-infused beans and fresh local cheese.
name: Casa oaxaca
address: Salina Cruz 205, Jacarandas, 68140 Oaxaca de Juárez, Oax., Mexico

detail_description: TranSierra Norte offers an unforgettable experience for travelers seeking adventure in Oaxaca. Visitors can expect five amazing, challenging days of riding, complemented by cultural excursions to ancient ruins and mezcal tastings. The company takes care of every detail, from organizing hotel accommodations to providing a headquarters for meeting up and planning activities.
name: TranSierra Norte
address: Benito Juárez 123, Xochimilco, 68040 Oaxaca de Juárez, Oax., Mexico
